text: Gibson v. United States, 329 U.S. 338 (1946), was a case in which the Supreme Court of the United States ruled that a Jehovah's Witness minister could appeal his classification without first appearing at induction camp.. ==References== ==External links== * Category:1946 in United States case law Category:United States Supreme Court cases Category:United States Supreme Court cases of the Vinson Court Category:Jehovah's Witnesses litigation in the United States Category:1946 in religion Category:Christianity and law in the 20th century
title: Gibson v. United States
